description: Ms. codex. Title from fol. 1b. Copied by Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Salṭī and completed in the middle of Rabīʻ al-Awwal 1074 (1663) -- colophon (fol. 196b). 15 lines per page. Written in a medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Text is written inside a single line frame in red ink. The frames on fol. 1b-2a are wider and outlined with several lines in red and black ink, with simple rectangular head pieces also outlined in several lines of red and black ink. Catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Glazed European paper. Short inscriptions on inside of upper cover and fol. 1a, a short text on fol. 200b and some poetry in Ottoman on fol. 201b. Incipit: من علامة الاعتماد على العمل نقصان الرجا عند وقوع الزلل لعلم نور الله قلبك بانوار المعارف Explicit: فهذا الشهود كان مع الله فى الحضرة بالمعية و بعد ذلك تكون فى الحضرة العندية
author: Ibn Zaghdān, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, 1417 or 1418-1477 or 1478
abstract: A commentary on Ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh's al-Ḥikam al-ʻAṭāʼīyah.
extent: 201 leaves : paper ; 208 x 144 (152 x 84) mm. bound to 210 x 155 mm.
title: Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Ḥikam
provenance: Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leyden, 1900.
creator: ابن زغدان، محمد بن احمد.
subject: Ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad, -1309—Ḥikam al-ʻAṭāʼīyah
binding note: Brown leather over pasteboard with envelope flap. Blind fillets around borders, and blind stamped mandorlas in the centre of covers and the envelope flap. Pastedowns and lining to the envelope flap in yellow paper. Lining to the fore edge flap in brown leather. Binding is damaged and some sheets are loose.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
